content.description:
This is a juggy and entertaining sport line ascending a small rib of of projecting golden angular blocks. Although the blocks are very positive, lets hope they are stuck on for the long term! Find the first bolt on a dark face about 10 feet up, then progress to a short yellow slab. Clip two quick bolts, then ascend the ladder of blocks. After the seventh bolt, you're at a small ledge with the bolted anchor up and left (somewhat awkward, but a nice pull).

There is a ~4-bolt variation (possibly an independent line?) ~5 feet to the left of the upper portion.
content.location: The first /lowest route on the 'Alpenkuhl' wall on the right side of Spire Gully. Hopefully the relative location and details above will get you oriented.

content.description:
Climb up to a juggy roof, grapple your way up and left and have faith! Airy and exciting.

This route is not called out in the book as requiring trad gear, but the crux is in a section about 30 feet long with no bolts. I don't know why this is, but it takes gear well enough.
content.location: To the right of the main face.

content.description: Steep blocky climbing leads to the main face, climbed using small cracks and positive edges.
content.location: Right up the middle of the main face.

content.description: Climb some blocky steep terrain to gain a big right-facing dihedral. Follow this up before breaking right onto the face, below a small roof. Finish with face climbing and some big reaches between big features.
content.location: Near the left side of the main face.

content.description: Juggy overhanging climbing up an arete leads up to a horizontal break with some vegetation, before resuming up the final headwall to the anchors.
content.location: The far left side of the main face.

pathTokens: Hwy 20 and North Cascades National Park
